header_summary: Antoine Riard supports starting small and focusing on consensus change primitives in the development approach, citing the success of taproot and the community-wide taproot review as examples. He also mentions the need to judge each BOLT individually based on its technical merits and discusses areas of Lightning Network operations that are not documented by the BOLTs. Antoine emphasizes the importance of the smooth functioning of the Lightning Network for Bitcoin's survival and expresses his intention to allocate his time and energy towards Lightning Network robustness and R&D works on CoinPool.

recent_posts.title: On the experiment of the Bitcoin Contracting Primitives WG and marking this community process "up for grabs"
recent_posts.summary: 1. Antoine Riard emphasizes the importance of consensus change primitives and thorough testing for proposed changes.2. He discusses the authority of BOLTs and mentions areas of Lightning Network operations not documented.3. Antoine expresses his focus on Lightning Network development and invites collaboration from developers interested in consensus changes.

recent_posts.title: Denial of Service using Package Relay
recent_posts.summary: 1. The user raised concerns about accepting unconfirmed inputs in coinjoin transactions due to potential safety risks.2. The coordinator should not accept unconfirmed UTXOs as they are unaware of the transaction and have zero fees.3. Package relay and upcoming RBF proposals could enhance security and efficiency in coinjoin transactions.

recent_posts.title: Standardisation of an unstructured taproot annex
recent_posts.summary: 1. The annex feature in Bitcoin's time-locked vaults provides powerful tools for covenants.2. Annex data is not included in transaction IDs, making it a safer option for backups.3. Joost's demo application showcases the potential of the annex for implementing advanced covenants.

recent_posts.title: Civ Kit: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Market System
recent_posts.summary: 1. Front-running in peer-to-peer marketplaces can occur when participants capitalize on advance knowledge for trading.2. Concerns were raised about the CivKit architecture resembling a brokerage rather than an exchange structure.3. Mitigating front-running includes duplicating offers, monitoring latency anomalies, and running bulletin boards as federations.

recent_posts.title: Some Day Peg: A crazy two-way peg bridging BTC to other chains Raw
recent_posts.summary: 1. Robin has shared an implementation of a two-way peg in Bitcoin Script on GitHub.2. The implementation includes functions for depositing and withdrawing funds between blockchains.3. This exploration showcases the potential of Bitcoin Script for creating complex smart contracts and blockchain interoperability.

recent_posts.title: New transaction policies (nVersion=3) for contracting protocols
recent_posts.summary: 1. Gloria Zhao proposes mempool/transaction relay policies to aid L2/contract protocols and address Rule 3 pinning.2. The proposal includes rules for V3 transactions, allowing for replaceability and limiting descendants.3. The new package relay policy replaces BIP125 and ensures incentive compatibility for replacement transactions.

recent_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
recent_posts.summary: 1. The annual specification meeting in NYC experimented with transcript-style notes.2. Attendees expressed gratitude to those who traveled and to the event host, Wolf.3. Michael Levin was thanked for his assistance in taking notes during the summit.

recent_posts.title: option_simple_close for "unfailable" closing
recent_posts.summary: 1. New protocol introduced for closing Lightning Network channels, simplifying the process and avoiding fee disagreements.2. Pull request includes three commits, adding detailed explanations and removing older protocols.3. Changes made to "02-peer-protocol.md", "03-transactions.md", and "09-features.md" files for easy review.

recent_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
recent_posts.summary: 1. LND does support paying invoices it generates through the `allow_self_payment` field.2. Setting up trusted channels allows for paying invoices without going through the network route.3. No built-in solution for self-payment exists, but workarounds like using specific flags or trusted channels are available.

recent_posts.title: An Open Source Framework to Collect Lightning Network Metrics
recent_posts.summary: 1. Vincent's side project focuses on collecting data on the Lightning Network to track its evolution and support research.2. The project aims to assess solutions like channel jamming and provide real data for university research.3. Vincent has created an experimental explorer and a public Graphql API to share the gathered information.

recent_posts.title: HTLC Endorsement for Jamming Mitigation
recent_posts.summary: 1. The Lightning Network community discussed potential damage from routing fees and on-chain fees.2. Reputation-based and monetary-based mitigation strategies were proposed for addressing attacks in the protocol.3. Participants emphasized the need for rigorous analysis and simulations to evaluate proposed solutions' effectiveness.

recent_posts.title: Computing Blinding Factors in a PTLC and Trampoline World
recent_posts.summary: 1. Bastien and ZmnSCPxj discuss a variation of the schnorr multi-hop locks mechanism for flexibility.2. ZmnSCPxj's proposal simplifies the process by eliminating the need to send left and right locks.3. The proposal introduces the `buildPath` function for generating paths and scalars in the protocol.

active_posts.title: Merkleize All The Things
active_posts.summary: 1. Johan Torås Halseth has implemented OP_CICV, OP_COCV, and OP_CAT in btcd, enabling interesting use cases.2. One such use case is CoinPools, where opcodes verify transactions and determine peer exits.3. Salvatore Ingala proposes a more efficient alternative using Merkle trees for indexing and handling data.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary: 1. Bob transfers bitcoins to Sally, who must then send an equal amount minus a fee to Carol.2. Burak suggests that if the service provider double-spends a transaction, Bob can claim previously spent bitcoins.3. Dave highlights the issue of Bob and Sally potentially being the same entity in a private protocol.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Transaction Relay over Nostr
active_posts.summary: 1. Joost Jager suggests delegating responsibility to relays for dealing with DoS threats in Bitcoin development.2. Dave Harding proposes relaying block templates and weak blocks to enhance transaction processing and fee estimation.3. Weak blocks offer DoS resistance and valuable insights for faster transaction inclusion in the next block.

active_posts.title: Proposal: Bundled payments
active_posts.summary: 1. Proposal to extend BOLT-11 suggests bundled payments with distinct preimages and amounts in an invoice.2. Bundled payments aim to solve challenges faced by lightning service providers in requesting prepayment.3. Implementation of bundled payments in BOLT-11 would level the playing field for lightning service providers.

active_posts.title: Liquidity griefing for 0-conf dual-funded txs
active_posts.summary: 1. Liquidity griefing attacks in dual-funded transactions pose a problem when one party goes silent.2. Proposed solution: never lock UTXOs to automatically reuse them if remote node goes silent.3. Nodes offering 0-conf channels must ensure isolated UTXOs to prevent accidental double-spending.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin mail list needs an explicit moderation policy
active_posts.summary: 1. Maxim Orlovsky proposes clear moderation policies for the bitcoin-dev mail list to ensure fairness and non-selective publishing.2. Orlovsky suggests replacing Bryan Bishop as moderator with a new candidate selected based on "least votes against" criteria.3. Orlovsky recommends creating an unmoderated mail list ("bitcoin-dev-unmoderated") to publish all submissions without censorship.
